Dear Yulonda Shell:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the violations
identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15
days from the date of the exit conference, must be completed and routed in CWLM, and must
include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. In
any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days from the date of the exit conference.
Failure to submit an acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions. In
the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact
the area manager Samantha Way at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Shannon (Shay) Mavis

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On or about 1/10/25, staff grabbed a youth by the shirt and hit the
youth in the face. On 1/11/15, youth told staff she was still upset
over the event and the staff member started to antagonize the
youth. Another staff member was standing between them. The
antagonistic staff member ran up on the youth and swung on the
youth, hitting the youth in the face.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Attempts were made to interview Youth A face to face at the
facility on 1/16/25 in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Youth
A refused to be interviewed despite multiple attempts made during
this visit.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 1/16/25
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported she was
involved in both situations. Staff 1 reported on 1/10/25, Youth A
requested to go to the bathroom to put on a face mask, so Staff 1
and Staff 5 went with Youth A to D-wing so she could use the
restroom. Staff 1 reported Youth A was already on edge when she
entered D-wing. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 was on D-wing and as
soon as she saw Youth A, Staff 2 stood up like Youth A was
already trying to attack her. Staff 1 reported when Youth A was on
D-wing, she was calmly talking to Staff 4 and wasn’t doing
anything wrong. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 was reacting to every
move Youth A made, which irritated Youth A. Youth A told Staff 2,
“girl, I’m not thinking about you”, and continued talking. Staff 2
reported she was going to step of the wing for a minute. Staff 1
reported as soon as Staff 2 walked out the door, Youth A grabbed
the door before it shut fully and went after Staff 2. Staff 2
screamed, “get her, get her”, and Staff 1 saw Youth A grabbing
Staff 2 by her hair. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 was holding onto Youth
A’s sleeve and her wrist. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 and Youth A were
going around in a circle while holding onto each other, and Youth
A’s shirt was splitting down the middle. Staff 1 reported Staff 2
was swinging on Youth A and kept saying “bitch” over and over.
Youth A said Staff 2 hit her in the face and then Staff 2 fell on the
2

floor. Staff 1 reported she was trying to shield Youth A the entire
time while Staff 4 and Staff 5 were trying to get Staff 2 off the floor
and away from Youth A. Staff1 reported Youth A refused to go
back to C-wing because she got hit. Staff 1 reported Supervisor
was present at the end of the situation and saw Youth A holding
Staff 2’s hair and Staff 2 holding Youth A’s shirt. Supervisor told
Staff 2 to get off the wing. Staff 2 reported Youth A did not have
any visible injuries from the situation. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 said,
“[Youth A] is not going to win. I’m going to keep working with her”.
On 1/11/25, Staff 1 reported she was assigned to supervise Youth
A on C-wing. Staff 1 reported she took Youth A to the bathroom
on D-wing and Youth A saw Staff 2. Staff 1 reported Youth A still
seemed irritated with Staff 2 regarding what happened on 1/10/25.
Staff 1 reported she talked to Supervisor about Youth A still being
upset and asked that Staff 2 not be put on rotation to supervise
Youth A because she knew there was going to be an incident.
Staff 1 reported Supervisor said she would investigate it, however
it doesn’t appear anything happened, because shortly later, Staff 2
reported for her 2-hour shift to supervise Youth A. Staff 1 reported
when Staff 2 reported for her shift, Staff 1 told Staff 2 to leave the
wing and said she could handle it by herself. Staff 1 reported
Youth A said, “why is this bitch here? I don’t like her. I’m about to
get a code clear called”. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 told Youth A,
“you’re scary as fuck. You can’t fight. All you do is pull hair. You
have nothing to lose and if I scan my badge and open the door,
you’re going to be looking stupid and slow because these kids on
D-wing are going to beat your ass”. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 was
standing by the door, and Staff 1 was sitting on the couch with
Youth A trying to keep her calm. Staff 1 reported Youth A said,
“that’s how you talk to a kid? I’m about to get up and act a fool”.
Staff 1 reported as soon as Youth A got up from the couch, Staff 1
got up and stood between Youth A and Staff 2 to intervene. Staff 1
reported Youth A was trying to grab Staff 2, but Staff 1 blocked it.
Staff 1 reported Youth A ended up in the corner behind the door
because Staff 2 attacked her after Youth A tried to attack Staff 2.
Staff 1 reported Staff 2 said “let’s restrain her”, but Youth A was
against the wall, and they’re not allowed to restrain a youth
against the wall, so Staff 1 refused to restrain Youth A. Staff 1
reported Supervisor and Staff 3 opened the door and entered the
wing, and as soon as they did, Staff 2 said, “bitch”, and did a
dragging punch down Youth A’s face. Staff 1 reported Supervisor
said, “uh uh, you have to get off the wing now” to Staff 2 and then
Staff 2 left. Staff 1 reported Youth A was upset afterwards and
said, “this bitch keeps hitting me”. Staff 1 reported the whole
situation could have been avoided if Staff 2 was never allowed to
3

be on the wing, or Staff 2 left the wing as soon as things started to
escalate like Staff 1 suggested she do. Staff 1 reported Staff 2
could have scanned her badge and walked out of the room at any
time, but she didn’t even attempt to do so. Staff 1 reported Staff 2
had multiple chances to get away, but instead, Staff 2 stayed.
Staff 1 reported it was as if Staff 2 was trying to get her hits in and
prove something in the situation. Staff 1 reported every time Staff
2 swung on Youth A, she called Youth A “bitch” repeatedly.
Staff 2 was interviewed via video conference on 1/14/25 in
coordination with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported
approximately 2 days prior to the first incident, she was on C-wing
relieving another staff working with Youth A. Staff 2 reported as
she was walking onto the wing, she let Youth A know she was
providing relief for another staff. Staff 2 reported she was wearing
a fanny pack and Youth A snatched it from her, and smashed
Staff 2’s phone on the floor, which broke it. Staff 2 reported as she
was going to pick it up, two other unknown staff went to hold
Youth A back because as Staff 2 was bending over to pick up her
phone, Youth A attempted to attack her from behind.
Staff 2 reported on 1/10/25, she was working on D-wing and
Youth A came to D-wing to go to the bathroom. Staff 2 reported as
Youth A exited the bathroom, Youth A was clearly agitated. Staff 2
reported when she saw Youth A was agitated, Staff 2 decided to
exit the wing to avoid any confrontations lingering from a couple
days prior. Staff 2 reported after she exited the door, Youth A ran
up behind her, pulled her ponytail, and pulled her backwards. Staff
2 reported an unknown staff pulled Youth A off her. Staff 2
reported she tried to grab Youth A’s wrist to get Youth A off her,
but Youth A’s shirt ripped because Staff 2 grabbed the wrist area
of Youth A’s shirt instead of Youth A’s body. Staff 2 reported
Youth A is supposed to be in a 2-buddy hold whenever she is not
on her wing but obviously, she wasn’t in the hold on D-wing
because Youth A was able to freely walk, grab the door, and
attack Staff 2. Staff 2 reported the entire situation could have been
avoided had staff been following protocol. Staff 2 reported
Supervisor asked Youth A why she always attacks Staff 2 and
Youth A said, “I don’t like new people. I’m picking them off one-by-
one”.
Staff 2 reported on 1/11/25, she asked Supervisor if she could not
work on C-wing with Youth A because Youth A had attacked her
multiple times over the previous couple days. Supervisor told Staff
2 “no” because Youth A is on a 2-hour staff rotation, and she
needed Staff 2 from 9-11 PM. Staff 2 reported Supervisor said,
4

“hopefully [Youth A] will be asleep during that time”. Staff 2
reported when she got on C-wing at the beginning of her 2-hour
shift, Youth A was wide awake. Staff 2 reported as soon as she
entered the wing, Youth A said, “I don’t want her on my wing”.
Staff 2 reported she knocked on the window and told Staff 3 Youth
A was already agitated and she didn’t want to be on C-wing with
Youth A. Staff 2 reported Staff 3 told her she needed to stay on
the wing, but he would watch through the window to ensure
nothing happened. Staff 2 reported Youth A asked Staff 2 to “go
30 seconds” with her and Youth A asked Staff 1 to leave the room
so she could be alone with Staff 2. Staff 2 reported she was
standing by the door with her badge in her hand, ready to leave if
something happened. Staff 2 reported Youth A ran up on her, and
Staff 2 responded by grabbing Youth A’s wrist. Staff 2 reported
Staff 1 used her shoulder to pin Youth A to the wall. Staff 2
reported she yelled “clear” over and over, but no one came. Staff
2 reported half the staff are on separation plans with Youth A and
cannot work with her. Staff 2 reported Youth A broke out of Staff
1’s hold because Staff 1 didn’t do the hold correctly. Staff 2
reported Staff 1 tried to verbally de-escalate Youth A. Staff 2
reported Youth A kept grabbing her hair. Staff 2 reported Staff 3
finally entered the wing and tried to verbally de-escalate Youth A.
Staff 2 reported Youth A swung at her with a closed fist, and Staff
2 was able to break away from Youth A. Staff 2 reported
Supervisor entered the room and said, “[Staff 1] exit the wing now
and go to my office”. Staff 2 reported she left and as she was
exiting, Youth A said, “bye bitch”. Staff 2 reported Supervisor met
with her and said she was taking her badge and keys because
there would be an investigation. Staff 2 reported Supervisor told
her to go to the police department and file a report of Youth A’s
assault on Staff 2. Staff 2 reported when she arrived at the police
station and told the officer where she worked, the officer guessed
she was coming to file a report about Youth A because so many
staff had already filed reports against her. Staff 2 reported she
never tried to hit Youth A, never hit Youth A, or anything similar.
Staff 2 reported she never instigated Youth A, insulted her, talked
about Youth A's fighting skills, or said anything about Youth A
getting beat up by other youth. Staff 2 reported she tried to do a
one person hold by herself (grabbing Youth A’s wrist), which she
knows she shouldn’t have done because it’s not an appropriate
hold, but she was trying to protect herself. Staff 2 reported she
was hoping Staff 1 would grab Youth A’s other arm so they could
put Youth A in a two person hold, but Staff 1 never did. Staff 2
reported she asked Supervisor for a separation plan prior to this
incident, but Supervisor told her there were already too many
other staff on separation plans with Youth A, so if Staff 2 was put
5

on a separation plan, there would be no one else to work with
Youth A. Staff 2 reported she had attempted to fix the issue with
Youth A by saying, “you keep running all the staff away, but I
didn’t do anything to you. What did I do and how can I fix this?”.
Staff 2 reported Youth A responded, “shut up bitch. Stop talking to
me”.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 1/16/25
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported he was
involved with the situation on 1/11/25. Staff 3 reported he is on a
separation plan with Youth A, so he cannot be on C-wing unless
there is a significant crisis. On 1/11/25, Youth A was on C-wing
with Staff 1 and Staff 2. Staff 3 reported he heard some
commotion on C-wing from the other side of the door, and then a
code clear was called over the radio. Staff 3 reported he and
Supervisor entered the wing to assist. Staff 3 reported Staff 1,
Staff 2, and Youth A were behind the door when they walked in.
Staff 3 reported it was clear Staff 2 and Youth A were in the
middle of an altercation because the situation was escalated and
there was a lot of yelling. Staff 3 reported due to the amount of
yelling, he could not pick out any specific comments Staff 2 made
to Youth A. Staff 3 reported he did not see Staff 2 and Youth A hit
each other because they were behind the door, and Supervisor
walked in before him. Staff 3 reported he and Supervisor
separated Staff 2 from Youth A, and Supervisor took Staff 2’s keys
away from her. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 was actively trying to keep
Youth A and Staff 2 separated as well. Staff 3 reported he
positioned himself in between Staff 2 and Youth A until Staff 2
exited the wing per Supervisor’s direction.
Staff 4 was interviewed via phone on 3/13/25 in coordination
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 reported she was on D-wing on
1/10/25, and Youth A came over from C-wing to use the
bathroom. Staff 4 reported Staff 2 was on D-wing. Staff 4 reported
she doesn’t recall what occurred between Staff 2 and Youth A.
Staff 4 reported she never saw Staff 2 hit Youth A, and she could
not remember whether Youth A hit Staff 2. Staff 4 reported she
didn’t hear anything Youth A and Staff 2 said to each other.
Staff 5 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 1/16/25
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Staff 5 reported she was
involved in the 1/10/25 incident. Staff 5 reported she was working
on C-wing with Youth A. Youth A went over to D-wing, and when
Youth A saw Staff 2 on D-wing, Youth A asked Staff 2, “do you
want to fight?”. Staff 5 reported Staff 2 tried to walk off the wing as
soon as she saw confrontation arising. Staff 5 reported Staff 2
6

exited through the door, and when the door was almost closed,
Youth A followed Staff 2 through the door and attacked her. Staff
5 reported Youth A grabbed Staff 2’s hair. Staff 5 reported Staff 2
was trying to put distance between her and Youth A by using CPI
training, but it was unsuccessful, and Youth A pushed Staff 2 onto
the floor. Staff 5 reported during the altercation, she and the other
staff were attempting to get in between Youth A and Staff 2 to put
space between them. Staff 5 reported Staff 1 was also present
during the situation, but she cannot remember who else was
present. Staff 5 reported Supervisor was involved towards the end
of the altercation. Staff 5 reported Staff 2 never tried to hit, slap, or
punch Youth A during the situation. Staff 5 reported Staff 2
grabbed Youth A’s shirt when she was trying to put distance
between them, and Youth A’s shirt ripped. Staff 5 reported Staff 2
was constantly trying to put distance between her and Youth A,
and did not instigate the situation. Staff 5 could not remember
anything Staff 2 said to Youth A.
Supervisor was interviewed via phone on 2/28/25 in
coordination with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor reported on
1/10/25, she was in her office training newly hired staff. Supervisor
reported she had the cameras pulled up on her computer and she
noticed Staff 2 was moving off D-wing. Supervisor reported she
saw Youth A was on D-wing, so Supervisor believed Staff 2 was
trying to get off D-wing to get out of Youth A’s way and avoid an
altercation. Supervisor reported Youth A would target certain staff
and would frequently switch which staff she targeted. Supervisor
reported she went to D-wing to provide support and heard two
staff (Staff 1 and Staff 4) asking Youth A why she would grab Staff
2 like that. Supervisor reported she retrieved a new shirt for Youth
A because Youth A’s shirt was ripped. Supervisor reported she did
not see the altercation or what happened, so she was not sure if
Staff 2 hit Youth A, escalated Youth A, or if she handled the
situation appropriately.
Supervisor reported on 1/11/25, Staff 1 and Staff 2 were assigned
to work with Youth A on C-wing. Supervisor reported she rotated
staff shifts on C-wing with Youth A every two hours because
Youth A was a lot to deal with for staff. Supervisor reported she
was in the emergency intake wing and heard a clear being called
over the radio, so she and Staff 3 reported to C-wing. Supervisor
reported when she entered the wing, Youth A, Staff 1 and Staff 2
were all behind the door when it opened. Supervisor reported she
looked behind the door and witnessed Staff 1 swing and hit Youth
A in the face with a closed fist. Supervisor reported she instructed
Staff 1 to leave the wing immediately and leave her keys on
7

Supervisor’s desk. Supervisor reported she had to sit on the wing
with Youth A for a little while and then met with Staff 2.
Supervisor reported the week prior to these incidents, Staff 2 met
with Supervisor and requested not to be on C-wing with Youth A.
Supervisor reported they were already short staffed, so she
explained to Staff 2 she was unable to grant staff requests to not
be with Youth A. Supervisor reported Youth A was lashing out at
everyone, and she couldn’t accommodate everyone being away
from Youth A. Supervisor reported Staff 2 was not the only staff to
request to not be with Youth A, and she had to ensure Youth A
had proper supervision. Supervisor reported this is why she came
up with a 2-hour rotation for staff, so the number of targeted
incidents towards staff by Youth A could be reduced, and staff
would be less overwhelmed in working with Youth A since it would
be shorter periods of time. Supervisor reported there were no
separation plans from Youth A for any staff because there was no
ability to do that with low staffing and Youth A’s frequent changes
in attitudes towards staff. Supervisor reported staff were told not to
have a cell phone, bring anything Youth A could take, bring
anything Youth A could destroy, or bring anything Youth A could
use as a weapon when they worked on C-wing. Supervisor
reported she always had cameras up for C-wing and was
constantly checking them, so she could watch and provide
additional support if there was an escalated situation or
emergency.
VIDEO FOOTAGE REVIEWED:
Video footage from 1/10/25 was reviewed. It should be noted the
video does not have audio. Staff 2 is seen walking through the
room, and Youth A runs up behind her. Staff 2 turns around
quickly. Staff 4 walked through a different door and entered the
same area. Staff 2 walked around the couch and got away from
Youth A. Another staff entered the room, but from the camera
angle, it’s unknown who entered the room. Staff 2 stood by the
door (off-camera). Youth A charged at Staff 2 and Staff 2 ran into
the middle of the room to get away from Youth A. Youth A
grabbed Staff 2’s jacket and swung her around. While Staff 1 was
being swung around, she grabbed onto Youth A’s shirt sleeve,
which stretched Youth A’s shirt and ripped it. Staff 1 and Staff 5
moved and got in between Youth A and Staff 2. Staff 2 fell to the
floor. Youth A and Staff 2 were each surrounded by staff to keep
them away from each other. Staff 2 was then escorted from the
area.
8

Video footage from 1/11/25 was reviewed. It should be noted the
video does not have audio. Staff 1 and Youth A are seen sitting on
the couch in the living area of C-wing while Staff 2 stands by the
door with her back against the wall. Staff 1 puts her arm around
Youth A’s shoulders and gives her a side hug and then removes
her arm from Youth A’s shoulders. Youth A stands up and begins
charging towards Staff 2, but Staff 1 immediately stands up and
puts her body in between Youth A and Staff 2. Youth A attempts
to go around the chair to get to Staff 2, but Staff 1 changes
positions and puts herself in between them again. Staff 2 is still by
the door and had the opportunity to exit the wing. Youth A charges
towards Staff 2 again, but Staff 1 stands in between them and
blocks Youth A. Staff 2 backs away towards the couch while Staff
1 is by the door blocking Youth A. Staff 2 walks up behind Staff 1
and gets closer to Youth A. Youth A then tries to go underneath
Staff 1’s arm to get to Staff 2. Staff 2 charges towards Youth A
with her hands outstretched and pushes Youth A into the corner.
Staff 1 is still trying to get in between Youth A and Staff 2 while
Staff 1 has Youth A pushed into the corner and holds her there.
The door to the wing opens and Staff 1, Staff 2 and Youth A are
behind the door. Staff 3 and Supervisor enter the wing and look
behind the door. Staff 2 backed up from Youth A and Staff 1 for a
couple seconds, but then charges back at them, swings her fist
and punches Youth A more than once. Staff 3 then gets in
between Youth A and Staff 2, grabs Staff 2’s upper arms and
guides her backwards away from the situation. Youth A squeezes
past Staff 1 to charge at Staff 2 again, but Supervisor gets in front
of Youth A to block her. Youth A pushes past Supervisor and
continues to charge. Staff 3 pushes Staff 2 into a little hall area
and turns around to block Youth A from getting to Staff 2.
Supervisor and Staff 3 get in front of Youth A, so she is unable to
get to Staff 2, which allows Staff 2 to get around them and exit the
wing. Staff 3 and Supervisor are holding Youth A’s wrists, but it
doesn’t appear they were utilizing this as a restraint method as
Youth A is not fighting against them, which means they are not
restricting Youth A’s movements.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Incident report dated 1/10/25 authored by Staff 2 states on
1/10/25, Youth A entered D-wing to use the restroom. After
Youth A was finished, Staff 5 and Staff 1 walked Youth A to
exit D-wing. Youth A stalled at the door and expressed she
wanted to “go 30 seconds” with Staff 2. Staff 2 exited the
wing. Youth A ran out the door before it could lock and
pulled Staff 2’s hair. Staff 5 and Staff 1 tried to verbally de-
escalate Youth A. Youth A grabbed Staff 2’s jacket. Staff 5
9

pulled Youth A off Staff 2 and Staff 2 exited the wing
completely.
• Incident report dated 1/11/25 authored by Staff 1 states
Youth A, Staff 1 and Staff 2 were sitting in the living area.
Youth A expressed she didn’t like Staff 2 because of the
altercation that occurred yesterday between Youth A and
Staff 2, which led to Youth A’s shirt getting ripped by Staff 2
and Staff 2 called Youth A names. Staff 2 told Youth A,
“you scary and you can’t fight. All you do is pull hair, and I
bet you won’t do this to your peers because you scared. If I
open this door and let them come over here, you gone be
scared looking stupid”. Immediately Youth A tried to get up
and charge at Staff 2, but Staff 1 stood in the middle
blocking Youth A’s punches. Staff 2 hit Youth A, and soon
after Supervisor came to assist with the situation and
removed Staff 2. Supervisor and Staff 3 heard a clear
(segregation for safety) being called from C-wing. Both
Supervisor and Staff 3 entered C-wing. Upon entering the
wing, Supervisor witnessed Staff 1 standing in between
Youth A and Staff 2. Staff 1 was attempting to block Staff 2
from hitting Youth A and Youth A from hitting Staff 2.
Supervisor witnessed Staff 2 swinging with a closed fist and
hitting Youth A in the face. Supervisor immediately told
Staff 2 to exit the wing. Supervisor and Staff 1 placed Youth
A in a CPI high hold; however, Youth A was able to break
away from their grip and ran towards Staff 2. Supervisor
and Staff 1 blocked Youth A from getting to Staff 2, and
Staff 2 exited the wing with help from Staff 3. After Staff 2
was off the wing, Youth A began to hit herself in the head
and scratch her face. Supervisor was able to talk to Youth
A and get her to calm down. Supervisor sent Staff 2 home
immediately and informed her Human Resources would
contact her on Monday.
• Youth A’s Safety Plan states staff are to remain calm in
their presentation and model possible body-based self-
regulation techniques. Staff are to structure the
environment and set healthy limits. Staff are to use calm
tones and supportive words while verbally de-escalating
Youth A. During transport, Youth A must buddy with 2 staff
minimum. Staff must have walkie talkies with them. Youth A
should not be transported without 2 staff. Safety plan does
not state Youth A must be held in a 2-person hold while
being transported.
10

• Vista Maria Staff and Client Interaction policy states
corporal punishment (spanking, paddling, slapping,
pinching, twisting arms, pulling hair, etc.) of youth is never,
under any circumstances, permitted. Undignified language,
cursing, and swearing are viewed as verbal abuse and are
prohibited.
• Vista Maria Behavior Management Policy states behavior
management interventions will not be used as a form of
discipline, to force compliance, or for the convenience of
staff. Various de-escalation techniques may be utilized to
maintain safety of youth and staff in the environment. Staff
must use the least restrictive, safest, and most effective
methods and recognize that symptoms are adaptations. All
staff are trained on the use of non-physical intervention
skills such as verbal de-escalation, mediation conflict
resolution, active listening, and verbal and observational
methods to prevent emergency safety situations.
• Staff 2 did not have any disciplinary actions in her
employee file prior to this incident. Staff 2 was terminated
from employment on 1/15/25 because of the 1/11/25
incident. Staff 2 completed CPI training on 12/16/24 and
12/24/24.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as per interviews
conducted, documentation reviewed, and video footage reviewed,
Staff 2 hit Youth A and pushed her into the corner of the room on
1/11/25 during the incident between them.
Staff 1 said Staff 2 was antagonizing Youth A on 1/11/25, but Staff
2 said she wasn’t. Since Youth A refused to be interviewed and
there is no audio on the video footage, it could not be confirmed
whether Staff 2 was antagonizing her prior to the physical
altercation.
Based on video footage reviewed, there is no information to
support Staff 2 hitting Youth A during the situation on 1/10/25.
Youth A’s shirt was ripped because Staff 2 grabbed onto Youth
A’s shirt after Youth A swung Staff 2 around. It appears the shirt
was ripped due to Staff 2’s momentum while she was being
swung around, rather than a malicious act against Youth A by
Staff 2.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
